articles.title: Azerbaijan, Armenia, U.S. Sign Key Agreements in Washington
articles.description: Azerbaijan, Armenia, and the United States signed landmark agreements in Washington on August 8, advancing the South Caucasus peace process and opening a new chapter in U.S.–Azerbaijan relations. The talks aimed at ending more than three decades of conflict.

articles.title: Trump’s Tariffs Come Into Force
articles.description: The United States began imposing tariffs of 10% or higher on goods from more than 60 countries and the European Union on Thursday. The economic fallout from President Donald Trump's tariff policy has already hit the U.S. economy, with growth and job gains slowing and inflation ticking upward.

articles.title: New Study Highlights ‘Grave, Growing’ Danger of Plastic Pollution to World’s Health
articles.description: A new study highlights the growing health dangers of plastic pollution. The research underscores the urgent need for global action to address the escalating crisis posed by plastic waste.
